title: Tripadvisor to cut 20% of staff amid internal restructuring
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Tripadvisor will cut 20% of its workforce as part of a strategic merger of its Tripadvisor and Viator brands.
The restructuring includes an $85 million cost-savings plan and focuses on making the company experience-led and AI-enabled.
Tripadvisor's move follows pressure from activist investor Starboard Value amid post-pandemic challenges and shifting focus to user experiences.

title: An abandoned tent has spurred a hiking mystery in New Hampshire
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: An abandoned tent was discovered in New Hampshire's White Mountains, sparking mystery among hikers and authorities.
Officials found wet gear and car keys at the tent site but received no reports of missing hikers.
A social media post about the tent prompted speculation but provided no leads on the owner's identity.

title: Local obituary: Susan Hurley, 62, former Patriots cheerleader who founded CharityTeams
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Susan Hurley, 62, former Patriots cheerleader, founded CharityTeams, raising $42 million for nonprofits through athletic events.
She was pivotal in training Boston Marathon charity runners and organizing events like 'Superhero 17' and 'Hop 21'.
A Celebration of Life is scheduled for November 8 in Norwood; donations can be made to her supported charities.

title: Market Basket launches its own beer — here’s where to buy it
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Market Basket partnered with Zero Gravity Beer to launch 'More For Your Dollar,' a new lager.
The beer is available in Massachusetts, Maine, and New Hampshire at select Market Basket locations.
The 12-pack of the new lager is priced at $12.99 and features Market Basket's logo and colors.

title: As SJC mulls involvement in public defender work stoppage, here’s where things stand
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Over 900 defendants in Massachusetts are without representation due to a public defender work stoppage initiated for higher pay.
The Supreme Judicial Court is deliberating whether judges can grant temporary pay increases for court-appointed attorneys.
Lawmakers approved a $20 hourly pay increase over two years for public defenders, which has not fully resolved the crisis.

title: Reese Witherspoon visits Boston bookstore
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Reese Witherspoon visited Beacon Hill Books and Cafe, signing copies of her novel 'Gone Before Goodbye' co-authored with Harlan Coben.
She attended a private dinner at the bookstore during her visit for a discussion at Harvard Business School.
Witherspoon reflected on her movie 'Legally Blonde' and promoted her initiative, Reese's Book Club, spotlighting female authors.

title: GOP lawmakers pushing Healey for info on aide arrested in cocaine bust
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: LaMar Cook, an aide to Gov. Maura Healey, was arrested for cocaine trafficking to a state office building.
Republican lawmakers demand Gov. Healey disclose vetting details for Cook and review executive branch procedures.
GOP candidates call for independent investigation into Healey's vetting process following Cook's arrest.

title: 2 teens killed in New Bedford crash identified
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Two teens, Gabriel Siqueira, 17, and Anne Urbanski Santos De Carvalho, 15, died in a New Bedford crash Saturday.
The crash occurred on Route 140 South; the teens were ejected from the gray 2019 Honda Civic in a wooded area.
The 18-year-old driver was hospitalized with non-life-threatening injuries; the crash remains under investigation.

title: BPD releases multiple photos of baseball-capped commercial burglary suspect
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Boston police are seeking a man involved in commercial burglaries using a pry tool to access downtown businesses since August.
The suspect has targeted multiple locations, stealing credit cards, cash, and electronics, including camera equipment.
Police from BU, Cambridge, and Northeastern reported similar break-ins; public asked to contact BPD at 617-343-4571 with info.

title: Report: Mike Vrabel’s former team was ‘unwilling’ to trade with Patriots
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: The Tennessee Titans reportedly refused to trade with the New England Patriots due to lingering issues with coach Mike Vrabel.
Titans owner Amy Adams Strunk holds ill will towards Vrabel, contributing to the unwillingness to aid his current team.
The Patriots, interested in acquiring players, ultimately decided not to make any trades before the recent NFL deadline.
